description: From New Latin stenōsis, from Ancient Greek στένωσις (sténōsis, “narrowing”), from στενόω (stenóō, “to confine, to contract”) +‎ -σις (-sis, nominal suffix), equivalent to steno- +‎ -osis.

entries.meaning: (medicine, pathology) An abnormal narrowing or stricture in a blood vessel or other tubular organ.
A reduction in either mental or physical capacity.
